applicationInfo.name: My Application
applicationInfo.description:
**Important**: This threat model is not comprehensive or complete. This document does not list all possible threats, and where threats do have mapped mitigations - these mitigations are not deemed to be complete.

Consider this as a starting point for your own diligence and threat modeling.

dataflow.description: **Note:** A data flow diagram has not been captured at this stage. You should consider creating a data-flow diagram.

metadata.value: The API Gateway is associated with a WAF (Web Application Firewall)

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for the Timestream database
threats.threatAction: view or modify the data
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for the Timestream database can view or modify the data, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of this application's data

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the Amazon SQS endpoint
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the Amazon SQS endpoint can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for the SQS (Simple Queue Service) topic
threats.threatAction: view or modify the SQS messages
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for the SQS (Simple Queue Service) topic can view or modify the SQS messages, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of this application

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the publisher and the Amazon SNS endpoint
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the publisher and the Amazon SNS endpoint can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses, negatively impacting this application's data

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for the SNS (Simple Notification Service) topic
threats.threatAction: view the SNS messages
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for the SNS (Simple Notification Service) topic can view the SNS messages, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of this application's data

threats.prerequisites: who has obtained a long-lived secret (e.g. password)
threats.threatAction: spoof an authenticated user or system
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to do anything the user or system can do
threats.statement: A threat actor who has obtained a long-lived secret (e.g. password) can spoof an authenticated user or system, which leads to the actor being able to do anything the user or system can do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with interactive access to the SageMaker notebook
threats.threatAction: take advantage of unfiltered / unrestricted access to the internet via the Sagemaker VPC
threats.threatImpact: download malicious code or tools; or exfiltrate data bypassing any centralised internet ingress/egress controls that may in place within your own VPC
threats.statement: A threat actor with interactive access to the SageMaker notebook can take advantage of unfiltered / unrestricted access to the internet via the Sagemaker VPC, which leads to download malicious code or tools; or exfiltrate data bypassing any centralised internet ingress/egress controls that may in place within your own VPC, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for the SageMaker notebook
threats.threatAction: view the contents of the notebook (e.g. code or query results)
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for the SageMaker notebook can view the contents of the notebook (e.g. code or query results), resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of this application's data

threats.prerequisites: who has discovered misconfigured S3 hosted website
threats.threatAction: bypass the protections put in place by CloudFront (e.g. geo blocking)
threats.statement: An external threat actor who has discovered misconfigured S3 hosted website can bypass the protections put in place by CloudFront (e.g. geo blocking), resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's data

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the Amazon S3 bucket endpoint
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the Amazon S3 bucket endpoint can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses, negatively impacting this application's data

threats.prerequisites: who is authenticated and authorized
threats.threatAction: deny taking a action associated with an Amazon S3 bucket
threats.threatImpact: lack of knowledge/proof of who took the action
threats.statement: A threat actor who is authenticated and authorized can deny taking an action associated with an Amazon S3 bucket, which leads to lack of knowledge/proof of who took the action

threats.prerequisites: who has discovered a S3 bucket configured for public read or write
threats.threatAction: read or write data to or from the S3 bucket
threats.statement: A threat actor who has discovered a S3 bucket configured for public read or write can read or write data to or from the S3 bucket, resulting in reduced confidentiality, integrity and/or availability of this application's data

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the Redshift cluster
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the Redshift cluster can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses, negatively impacting this application's data

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the Redshift cluster
threats.threatAction: attempt to take advantage of a known vulnerability in a component exposed by Redshift
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the Redshift cluster can attempt to take advantage of a known vulnerability in a component exposed by Redshift, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the Redshift cluster listener
threats.threatAction: perform a network probe the database using it's default port
threats.threatImpact: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the Redshift cluster listener can perform a network probe the database using it's default port, which leads to perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the Redshift cluster listener
threats.threatAction: brute-force the database credentials
threats.threatImpact: the ability to view or modify data
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the Redshift cluster listener can brute-force the database credentials, which leads to the ability to view or modify data, negatively impacting this application's data

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for the Redshift cluster
threats.threatAction: view the contents of the database
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for the Redshift cluster can view the contents of the database, resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's data

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for the RDS cluster
threats.threatAction: view the contents of the database
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for the RDS cluster can view the contents of the database, resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's data

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the RDS cluster listener
threats.threatAction: perform a network probe the database using it's default port
threats.threatImpact: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the RDS cluster listener can perform a network probe the database using it's default port, which leads to perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the RDS cluster or instance
threats.threatAction: attempt to take advantage of a known vulnerability in a component exposed by RDS
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the RDS cluster or instance can attempt to take advantage of a known vulnerability in a component exposed by RDS, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the RDS database listener
threats.threatAction: brute-force the database credentials
threats.threatImpact: the ability to view or modify data
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the RDS database listener can brute-force the database credentials, which leads to the ability to view or modify data, negatively impacting this application's data

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between Quicksight and it's data source
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between Quicksight and it's data source can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses, negatively impacting this application's data

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the OpenSearch nodes
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the OpenSearch nodes can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses, negatively impacting this application's data

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for the OpenSearch cluster
threats.threatAction: view the contents of the database
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for the OpenSearch cluster can view the contents of the database, resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's data

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the OpenSearch domain
threats.threatAction: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.threatImpact: the ability to view or modify data
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the OpenSearch domain can perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface, which leads to the ability to view or modify data, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the Neptune database listener
threats.threatAction: brute-force the database credentials
threats.threatImpact: the ability to view or modify data
threats.statement: An external threat actor with a network path to the Neptune database listener can brute-force the database credentials, which leads to the ability to view or modify data, negatively impacting this application's Neptune data

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for the Neptune cluster
threats.threatAction: view the contents of the database
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for the Neptune cluster can view the contents of the database, resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's Neptune data

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the Neptune cluster or instance
threats.threatAction: attempt to take advantage of a known vulnerability in a component exposed by Neptune
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the Neptune cluster or instance can attempt to take advantage of a known vulnerability in a component exposed by Neptune, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the Amazon MSK (Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka) cluster broker
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the Amazon MSK (Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka) cluster broker can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses

threats.prerequisites: with access to a valid and authorized IAM Principal
threats.threatAction: take advantage of unnecessary permissions included in the associated MediaStore container policy
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to do anything the user can do (for example: perform all supported operations on the container)
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to a valid and authorized IAM Principal can take advantage of unnecessary permissions included in the associated MediaStore container policy, which leads to the actor being able to do anything the user can do (for example: perform all supported operations on the container), negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the MediaStore container
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the MediaStore container can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses

threats.prerequisites: who has discovered a XSS (Cross-site scripting) vulnerability on assets hosted on MediaStore container
threats.threatAction: cause unintended external resources such as javascript, images or videos to loaded within the context of the website
threats.statement: An external threat actor who has discovered an XSS (Cross-site scripting) vulnerability on assets hosted on MediaStore container can cause unintended external resources such as javascript, images or videos to loaded within the context of the website, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with the ability to invoke or interact with a Lambda function
threats.threatAction: take advantage of a disclosed vulnerability within the runtime version used for a non-container based Lambda function
threats.statement: A threat actor with the ability to invoke or interact with a Lambda function can take advantage of a disclosed vulnerability within the runtime version used for a non-container based Lambda function, resulting in reduced confidentiality, integrity and/or availability of this application

threats.prerequisites: who has discovered the Lambda Function URL
threats.threatAction: invoke the function without any authentication
threats.threatImpact: allowing the actor to perform the actions permitted by the associated Lambda function
threats.statement: An external threat actor who has discovered the Lambda Function URL can invoke the function without any authentication, which leads to allowing the actor to perform the actions permitted by the associated Lambda function, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for a Kinesis Data Stream
threats.threatAction: view the contents of the stream
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for a Kinesis Data Stream can view the contents of the stream, resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's Kinesis Data Stream

threats.prerequisites: with access to underlying storage used for a Kinesis Data Firehouse delivery stream
threats.threatAction: view the contents of the stream
impactedAssets: this application's Kinesis Data Firehouse delivery stream
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to underlying storage used for a Kinesis Data Firehouse delivery stream can view the contents of the stream, resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's Kinesis Data Stream and this application's Kinesis Data Firehouse delivery stream

threats.prerequisites: with access to a valid IAM Principal
threats.threatAction: take advantage of unnecessary permissions included in the associated IAM Policy
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to do anything the user can do
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to a valid IAM Principal can take advantage of unnecessary permissions included in the associated IAM Policy, which leads to the actor being able to do anything the user can do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with access to Amazon S3 bucket used for Glue job bookmarks
threats.threatAction: view the contents of the bookmarks
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to Amazon S3 bucket used for Glue job bookmarks can view the contents of the bookmarks, resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's Glue job bookmarks

threats.prerequisites: with access to the CloudWatch Log storage
threats.threatAction: view or modify the contents of the logs
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to the CloudWatch Log storage can view or modify the contents of the logs, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of glue crawler or job logs

threats.prerequisites: who has discovered the Event Bridge event bus (e.g. Endpoint ID)
threats.threatAction: put arbitrary events onto the bus
threats.threatImpact: those events being processed by the application
threats.statement: An external threat actor who has discovered the Event Bridge event bus (e.g. Endpoint ID) can put arbitrary events onto the bus, which leads to those events being processed by the application, resulting in reduced confidentiality, integrity and/or availability of this application

threats.prerequisites: with access to the EMR local storage
threats.threatAction: view or modify the contents on the disk
threats.statement: A threat actor with access to the EMR local storage can view or modify the contents on the disk, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of data within the EMR cluster

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the EMR cluster
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the EMR cluster can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the EMR cluster listener not configured with authentication
threats.threatAction: perform unauthenticated commands to the cluster
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the EMR cluster listener not configured with authentication can perform unauthenticated commands to the cluster, resulting in reduced confidentiality, integrity and/or availability of this application

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the CLB (Classic Load Balancer)
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the CLB (Classic Load Balancer) can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the ALB (Application Load Balancer)
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the client and the ALB (Application Load Balancer) can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses

threats.prerequisites: that discovers an Elastic Beanstalk environment in a public subnet
threats.threatAction: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: A threat actor that discovers an Elastic Beanstalk environment in a public subnet can perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the Elastic Beanstalk environment
threats.threatAction: attempt to take advantage of a known vulnerability in a platform component used by Elastic Beanstalk
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the Elastic Beanstalk environment can attempt to take advantage of a known vulnerability in a platform component used by Elastic Beanstalk, resulting in reduced integrity, availability and/or confidentiality of this application

threats.prerequisites: who is authenticated and authorized
threats.threatAction: deny taking a action that is orchestrated via Elastic Beanstalk environment
threats.threatImpact: lack of knowledge/proof of who took the action
threats.statement: A threat actor who is authenticated and authorized can deny taking an action that is orchestrated via Elastic Beanstalk environment, which leads to lack of knowledge/proof of who took the action

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the ElastiCache Redis cluster listener not configured with IAM authentication
threats.threatAction: perform unauthenticated commands to the cluster
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the ElastiCache Redis cluster listener not configured with IAM authentication can perform unauthenticated commands to the cluster, resulting in reduced confidentiality, integrity and/or availability of this application

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the user and the ElastiCache Redis cluster
threats.threatAction: view plaintext requests and responses
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the user and the ElastiCache Redis cluster can view plaintext requests and responses, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the requests or responses

threats.prerequisites: with physical access to ElastiCache Redis storage
threats.threatAction: view or modify the contents on the disk
impactedAssets: data within the ElastiCache Redis cluster
threats.statement: A threat actor with physical access to ElastiCache Redis storage can view or modify the contents on the disk, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of data within the ElastiCache Redis cluster

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the ElastiCache cluster listener
threats.threatAction: perform a network probe the database using it's default port
threats.threatImpact: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the ElastiCache cluster listener can perform a network probe the database using it's default port, which leads to perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.threatAction: discover the ElastiCache cluster that has a public IP address
threats.threatImpact: reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor can discover the ElastiCache cluster that has a public IP address, which leads to reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application and data within the ElastiCache cluster

threats.prerequisites: who has discovered a EKS cluster Kubernetes API server endpoint
threats.threatAction: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor who has discovered an EKS cluster Kubernetes API server endpoint can perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who is authenticated and authorized
threats.threatAction: deny taking a action that is performed via the EKS control plane
threats.threatImpact: lack of knowledge/proof of who took the action
threats.statement: A threat actor who is authenticated and authorized can deny taking an action that is performed via the EKS control plane, which leads to lack of knowledge/proof of who took the action

threats.prerequisites: with physical access to EFS (Elastic File System) storage
threats.threatAction: view or modify the contents on the disk
threats.statement: A threat actor with physical access to EFS (Elastic File System) storage can view or modify the contents on the disk, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of data within the EFS mount

threats.prerequisites: that can view the ECS Task Definition
threats.threatAction: can obtain any AWS Access Key and Secret Access Key that may be stored there
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to take any action that the IAM Principal associated with the keys is able to do
threats.statement: An actor that can view the ECS Task Definition can can obtain any AWS Access Key and Secret Access Key that may be stored there, which leads to the actor being able to take any action that the IAM Principal associated with the keys is able to do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who is authenticated and authorized
threats.threatAction: deny taking a action that is orchestrated via an ECS Task
threats.threatImpact: lack of knowledge/proof of who took the action
threats.statement: A threat actor who is authenticated and authorized can deny taking an action that is orchestrated via an ECS Task, which leads to lack of knowledge/proof of who took the action

threats.prerequisites: who as discovered a ECR repository
threats.threatAction: access the container images hosted within the repository
threats.threatImpact: information disclosure that aid in the intrusion activities being successful against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor who as discovered an ECR repository can access the container images hosted within the repository, which leads to information disclosure that aid in the intrusion activities being successful against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with established persistence within a host in the VPC
threats.threatAction: go unnoticed for a prolonged period due unnecessary Security Groups being kept as their rationale for existence is not clear
threats.statement: A threat actor with established persistence within a host in the VPC can go unnoticed for a prolonged period due unnecessary Security Groups being kept as their rationale for existence is not clear

threats.threatAction: discover EC2 instances that have public IP addresses and allow ingress to all internet addresses to SSH, or move laterally to non-public EC2 instances via SSH
threats.threatImpact: reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor can discover EC2 instances that have public IP addresses and allow ingress to all internet addresses to SSH, or move laterally to non-public EC2 instances via SSH, which leads to reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.threatAction: discover EC2 instances that have public IP addresses and allow ingress to all internet addresses, or move laterally to non-public EC2 instances
threats.threatImpact: reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor can discover EC2 instances that have public IP addresses and allow ingress to all internet addresses, or move laterally to non-public EC2 instances, which leads to reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to a listener(s) configured on an EC2 instance
threats.threatAction: perform a network probe on common service ports (e.g. 20, 21, 3389, 3309, 3306, 4333)
threats.threatImpact: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to a listener(s) configured on an EC2 instance can perform a network probe on common service ports (e.g. 20, 21, 3389, 3309, 3306, 4333), which leads to perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: that has discovered a legacy EC2-Classic instance
threats.threatAction: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: A threat actor that has discovered a legacy EC2-Classic instance can perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface

threats.prerequisites: with access to an EC2 instance
threats.threatAction: can steal any long-lived AWS credentials (AWS Access Key, AWS Secret Key) being stored on the instance
threats.threatImpact: the actor to take any action that the credentials allowed can do, and can do so from outside of the EC2 instance and until the credentials are manually revoked
threats.statement: An external threat actor with access to an EC2 instance can can steal any long-lived AWS credentials (AWS Access Key, AWS Secret Key) being stored on the instance, which leads to the actor to take any action that the credentials allowed can do, and can do so from outside of the EC2 instance and until the credentials are manually revoked

threats.prerequisites: with physical access to EBS (Elastic Block Store) storage
threats.threatAction: view or modify the contents on the disk
threats.statement: A threat actor with physical access to EBS (Elastic Block Store) storage can view or modify the contents on the disk, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of data within the EBS volume

threats.prerequisites: with physical access to DAX storage
threats.threatAction: view or modify the contents of the database
impactedAssets: data written to disk by the DAX cluster
threats.statement: A threat actor with physical access to DAX storage can view or modify the contents of the database, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of data written to disk by the DAX cluster

threats.prerequisites: who can view the DocumentDB configuration
threats.threatAction: obtain the username and password for the DocumentDB cluster
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to access anything the associated DocumentDB user is authorised to do
threats.statement: A threat actor who can view the DocumentDB configuration can obtain the username and password for the DocumentDB cluster, which leads to the actor being able to access anything the associated DocumentDB user is authorised to do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the DocumentDB database listener
threats.threatAction: perform a network probe the database using it's default port
threats.threatImpact: perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the DocumentDB database listener can perform a network probe the database using it's default port, which leads to perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with physical access to DocumentDB storage
threats.threatAction: view or modify the contents of the database
threats.statement: A threat actor with physical access to DocumentDB storage can view or modify the contents of the database, resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of data hosted within the database

threats.threatAction: discover DMS (Database Migration Services) instances that have public IP addresses
threats.threatImpact: reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor can discover DMS (Database Migration Services) instances that have public IP addresses, which leads to reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who has discovered an application endpoint with Cognito authenticated logins
threats.threatAction: perform a dictionary or brute force attack to authenticate as an authorized Cognito user
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to do anything the associated Cognito user is authorised to do
threats.statement: A threat actor who has discovered an application endpoint with Cognito authenticated logins can perform a dictionary or brute force attack to authenticate as an authorized Cognito user, which leads to the actor being able to do anything the associated Cognito user is authorised to do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who has discovered an application endpoint with Cognito authenticated logins
threats.threatAction: perform any unauthenticated actions allowed by the Cognito user pool configuration
threats.threatImpact: reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: A threat actor who has discovered an application endpoint with Cognito authenticated logins can perform any unauthenticated actions allowed by the Cognito user pool configuration, which leads to reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who is able brute force, or has knowledge of valid Amazon Cognito usernames and passwords
threats.threatAction: spoof an authenticated user
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to do anything the user can do
threats.statement: A threat actor who is able brute force, or has knowledge of valid Amazon Cognito usernames and passwords can spoof an authenticated user, which leads to the actor being able to do anything the user can do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the API
threats.threatAction: access the API using a method other than Cognito user pool authentication
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to do anything a authenticated or unauthenticated user is permitted to do
threats.statement: An external threat actor with a network path to the API can access the API using a method other than Cognito user pool authentication, which leads to the actor being able to do anything an authenticated or unauthenticated user is permitted to do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with valid user credentials
threats.threatAction: authenticate as a the valid user from a geo-location not associated with the valid users established baseline
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to do anything the user can do
threats.statement: An external threat actor with valid user credentials can authenticate as a the valid user from a geo-location not associated with the valid users established baseline, which leads to the actor being able to do anything the user can do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with access to a compromised credential list (e.g. purchased from the dark web)
threats.threatAction: perform credential stuffing against a valid Cognito user in the pool that has re-used a password present in the compromised list
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to do anything the user can do
threats.statement: An external threat actor with access to a compromised credential list (e.g. purchased from the dark web) can perform credential stuffing against a valid Cognito user in the pool that has re-used a password present in the compromised list, which leads to the actor being able to do anything the user can do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who is able to influence what commands are run within a CodeBuild job
threats.threatAction: take run commands supported by 'privilegedMode'
threats.threatImpact: them accessing the Docker API and associated resources
threats.statement: A threat actor who is able to influence what commands are run within a CodeBuild job can take run commands supported by 'privilegedMode', which leads to them accessing the Docker API and associated resources, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: who can trick a user into using a external vulnerable or malicious Docker image in their CodeBuild project
threats.threatAction: tamper with the build process
threats.statement: A threat actor who can trick a user into using an external vulnerable or malicious Docker image in their CodeBuild project can tamper with the build process, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with physical access to CodeBuild storage
threats.threatAction: view or modify build artefacts (e.g. cache, logs, exported raw test report data files, and build results)
threats.statement: A threat actor with physical access to CodeBuild storage can view or modify build artefacts (e.g. cache, logs, exported raw test report data files, and build results), resulting in reduced confidentiality and/or integrity of this application's build artefacts

threats.prerequisites: that can view the CodeBuild environment variables
threats.threatAction: can obtain any AWS Access Key and Secret Access Key that may be stored there
threats.threatImpact: the actor being able to take any action that the IAM Principal associated with the keys is able to do
threats.statement: An actor that can view the CodeBuild environment variables can can obtain any AWS Access Key and Secret Access Key that may be stored there, which leads to the actor being able to take any action that the IAM Principal associated with the keys is able to do, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the CloudFront Distribution
threats.threatAction: make arbitrary web requests that are either not explicitly allowed, blocked or counted
threats.threatImpact: them perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the content served by the CloudFront Distribution
threats.statement: An external threat actor with a network path to the CloudFront Distribution can make arbitrary web requests that are either not explicitly allowed, blocked or counted, which leads to them perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the content served by the CloudFront Distribution, negatively impacting this application

threats.threatAction: bypass the CloudFront Distribution and associated controls (e.g. Geo-blocking)
threats.threatImpact: direct access to static assets hosted on the Amazon S3 Origin
impactedAssets: assets hosted on the S3 Origin for this application
threats.statement: An external threat actor can bypass the CloudFront Distribution and associated controls (e.g. Geo-blocking), which leads to direct access to static assets hosted on the Amazon S3 Origin, negatively impacting assets hosted on the S3 Origin for this application

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between CloudFront Distribution and the origin
threats.threatAction: take advantage of a vulnerability in an older/depreciated SSL/TLS protocol
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the content from the origin and served by the CloudFront Distribution
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between CloudFront Distribution and the origin can take advantage of a vulnerability in an older/depreciated SSL/TLS protocol, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the content from the origin and served by the CloudFront Distribution

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the user and the CloudFront Distribution
threats.threatAction: take advantage of a vulnerability in an older/depreciated SSL/TLS protocol
threats.threatImpact: them being able manipulate view or modify the content served by the CloudFront Distribution
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the user and the CloudFront Distribution can take advantage of a vulnerability in an older/depreciated SSL/TLS protocol, which leads to them being able manipulate view or modify the content served by the CloudFront Distribution

threats.threatAction: discover application web assets that are exposed via CloudFront distributions
threats.threatImpact: reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor can discover application web assets that are exposed via CloudFront distributions, which leads to reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.threatAction: discover Cloud9 EC2 instances that have public IP addresses and that are exposing SSH
threats.threatImpact: reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor can discover Cloud9 EC2 instances that have public IP addresses and that are exposing SSH, which leads to reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.threatAction: discover EC2 instances that have public IP addresses
threats.threatImpact: reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface
threats.statement: An external threat actor can discover EC2 instances that have public IP addresses, which leads to reconnaissance and intrusion activities being performed against the exposed attack surface, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with physical access to Amazon S3 bucket used for Athena workgroup storage
threats.threatAction: view the results of Athena queries
threats.statement: A threat actor with physical access to Amazon S3 bucket used for Athena workgroup storage can view the results of Athena queries, resulting in reduced confidentiality of this application's Athena queries

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to, and authorization to use the API
threats.threatAction: can supply unexpected HTTP headers or JSON payload to the API
threats.threatImpact: the application behaving in unintended ways
threats.statement: An external threat actor with a network path to, and authorization to use the API can can supply unexpected HTTP headers or JSON payload to the API, which leads to the application behaving in unintended ways, negatively impacting this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the API
threats.threatAction: make unauthenticated calls to the API
threats.statement: An external threat actor with a network path to the API can make unauthenticated calls to the API, resulting in reduced confidentiality, integrity and/or availability of this application

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the API
threats.threatAction: make arbitrary web requests that are either not explicitly allowed, blocked or counted
threats.threatImpact: them perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the API
threats.statement: An external threat actor with a network path to the API can make arbitrary web requests that are either not explicitly allowed, blocked or counted, which leads to them perform reconnaissance and intrusion activities against the API, negatively impacting this application
